description: Disability insurance synthetic data template. Disability insurance helps protect an individualâ€™s income in case they are unable to work due to a medical illness, mental health issue, or injury. There are various types of disability insurance, including individual and group plans, and short-term and long-term disability plans.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the disability insurance policy (e.g., DI-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the disability insurance policy was activated.

PolicyType.description: Type of disability insurance policy (Individual, Group, or Government).

CoverageType.description: Type of coverage the policyholder is enrolled in (Short-Term Disability or Long-Term Disability).

IncomeReplacementPercentage.description: Percentage of income replaced by the disability insurance policy, typically between 60% to 90%.

BenefitAmount.description: Amount of disability benefits paid to the policyholder.

BenefitStartDate.description: Date when the disability benefits begin after the qualifying event (e.g., injury, illness).

BenefitEndDate.description: Date when the disability benefits end, either due to recovery or the end of the benefit period.

MedicalCondition.description: Description of the medical condition that led to the disability claim (e.g., Major Depression, Injury, Cancer).

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of the disability claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid out for the disability claim.

WaitingPeriod.description: Number of days before the disability benefits start, known as the waiting period.

TaxStatus.description: Tax status of the disability benefits (Taxable or Tax-Free).

DisabilityDuration.description: Duration of the disability period (in months).

RehabilitationSupport.description: Indicates whether rehabilitation support is provided as part of the policy.

CoverageLimit.description: Maximum coverage limit for the disability benefits.
